greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array T(n,k), n >= 0, k >= 0, read by antidiagonals, where T(n,k) = Sum_{j=0..n} binomial(n,j) * binomial(k*n+j+1,n)/(k*n+j+1).
formula: G.f. of column k A_k(x) satisfies A_k(x) = 1 + x * A_k(x)^k * (1 + A_k(x)).
T(n,k) = (1/n) * Sum_{j=1..n} 2^j * binomial(n,j) * binomial(k*n,j-1) for n > 0.
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := Sum[Binomial[n, j] * Binomial[k*n+j+1, n]/(k*n+j+1), {j, 0, n}]; Table[T[k, n-k], {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Amiram Eldar_, May 01 2021 *)
program: (PARI) {T(n, k) = sum(j=0, n, binomial(k*n+1, j)*binomial((k+1)*n-j, n-j))/(k*n+1)}
xref: If Michael D. Weiner's conjecture on A260332 is correct, column 4 is A260332 for n > 0.
results.author: _Seiichi Manyama_, Jul 25 2020
